description: Time-of-use distribution assumptions for calculating projected costs on TOU plans. Since hourly smart meter data is not available in demo, these assumptions model typical usage patterns.

peak.description: Highest demand period when grid is stressed

baseline_residential_assumptions.description: Typical time-of-use distribution for standard residential customers without special loads (no EV, no pool)
baseline_residential_assumptions.source: Industry research on residential usage patterns
notes: 20% during peak: Cooking dinner, evening activities
30% during super off-peak: HVAC overnight, always-on loads

work_from_home.description: People working from home use more electricity during typical off-peak daytime hours
work_from_home.notes: Higher daytime usage for computers, lighting, climate control

retired_elderly.description: Retirees tend to have more evenly distributed usage throughout the day
retired_elderly.notes: Home all day, less overnight usage

young_professionals.description: Away during day, heavy usage in evenings
young_professionals.notes: Higher peak usage - cooking, entertainment after work

ev_charging.description: EV charging patterns and TOU optimization

scenario_already_optimized.description: Customer already charges overnight (detected from usage curve)
scenario_already_optimized.notes: 90% of EV charging happens during super off-peak (11pm-7am)

scenario_not_optimized.description: Customer charging during peak or off-peak hours
scenario_not_optimized.notes: Could shift 70% of charging to super off-peak with behavior change

pool_equipment.description: Pool pump and heating equipment operation patterns

scenario_current_peak_hours.description: Pool equipment running during afternoon/evening peak hours
scenario_current_peak_hours.notes: 100% of pool usage during peak - worst case scenario

scenario_optimized_overnight.description: Pool equipment shifted to overnight operation with timer
scenario_optimized_overnight.notes: 100% of pool usage during super off-peak - optimal

notes: Overlaps significantly with peak rate period
Best value when excess sells at retail or near-retail rates

example_baseline_home.description: Standard home, 1000 kWh/month, TOU plan with $0.160 peak / $0.075 off-peak / $0.045 super off-peak

example_ev_owner_optimized.description: Home with EV, 1400 kWh/month (1000 baseline + 400 EV), EV charging overnight, same TOU plan

example_pool_owner_optimized.description: Home with pool, 1350 kWh/month (1000 baseline + 350 pool), pool shifted to overnight

assumptions_based_on: Austin Energy smart meter aggregate data
limitations: Weather impacts not modeled in detail
metadata.notes: For production system with hourly smart meter data, these assumptions would be replaced with actual usage curves. For demo, these provide realistic cost projections.
